# A ladder with a twist - 300
	Keithâ€™s friends have just sent a bitmap image that Keith suspects to contain some sort of instructive text. Find the flag!

[image](message.bmp)

------------------

[how to decode](http://www.extremetech.com/extreme/134672-harvard-cracks-dna-storage-crams-700-terabytes-of-data-into-a-single-gram)
tl;dr T and G = 1, A and C = 0.

There are only 4 possible combinations for the colors and values, just try all of them. Code:

```python
from PIL import Image

im = Image.open("message.bmp")
width, height = im.size

out = ''
i = 0
for pixel in im.getdata():
    if i > width:
        break
    #print(pixel)
    if pixel == (255,255,0):
        out += '0'
    elif pixel == (0,255,255):
        out += '1'
    elif pixel == (255,0,0):
        out += '1'
    else:
        out += '0'
    i = i + 1

out = out.replace('1'*10,'1')
out = out.replace('0'*10,'0')

print(out)
```

The output:

``

We convert the binary to ascii for a flag.

Flag: `DNA_stands_for_deoxyribonucleic_acid_and_is_two_stranded_as_opposed_to_RNA_DNA_consists_of_a_sugar_and_phosphate_backbone_and_four_nitrogenous_bases`
